text:
Clockwise from top left: Dakota Johnson, Mavis Spencer, Lorraine Nicholson, Sam Fox Getty Images

Chosen by the HFPA, the Golden Globe Ambassador - previously known as Miss or Mr. Golden Globe - is traditionally the daughter or son of one of the industry's most respected actors/actresses/directors/producers and assists during the Golden Globe Awards ceremony. The tradition started in 1962 and over the years has introduced many second and third generation stars; among them: Linda Evans, Anne Archer, Laura Dern, Melanie Griffith and her daughter, Dakota Johnson. In 2017 the title has been changed to Golden Globe Ambassador to better reflect the role and express the inclusiveness that has always been central to the Hollywood Foreign Press Association's mandate.

Lamas 2004 Lily Costner 2005 Kathryn Eastwood 2006 Dakota Johnson 2007 Lorraine Nicholson 2008 – 2009 Rumer Willis 2010 Mavis Spencer 2011 Gia Mantegna 2012 Rainey Qualley 2013 Francesca Eastwood, Sam Fox 2014 Sosie Bacon 2015 Greer Grammer 2016 Corinne Foxx 2017 Sistine, Sophia and Scarlet Stallone 2018 Simone Garcia Johnson 2019 Isan Elba 2020 Dylan and Paris Brosnan
